intro: Collomia debilis var. trifida, commonly known as the three-leaved collomia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. It has trifoliate leaves, which are divided into three leaflets, giving it its common name. This species is often considered a rare or endangered plant in parts of its range due to habitat loss and limited distribution.
